alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 08 at 2:34AM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Impactful Winter Storm Expected from Tonight into Tuesday Night... .A winter storm is expected to bring impactful and hazardous winter weather to the region starting tonight. Conditions are expected to be the worst from late tonight into Tuesday evening. Hourly snow rates will range from 1 to 2 inches an hour in parts of northeast Iowa, and southwest and central Wisconsin from late tonight into Tuesday afternoon. A total of 8 to 12 inches of snow is expected in these areas. Up to 40 mph wind gusts are expected at times from Tuesday afternoon into Tuesday night. This will result in blowing and drifting snow, especially in more open areas. The path of this storm could still shift which would result in a change in snowfall amounts. This is why there is a Winter Storm Watch along and north of Interstate 90. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota and central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
